page.title: 14Leisure in Halsall
page.content: The playing field has cricket and football pitches and a new pavilion is under construction. As well as swings, a slide and a roundabout, there are public toilets and a telephone. Other sporting favourites are squash, whist and dominoes as well as badminton. The public house in Halsall is called "The Halsall Arms" reflecting the close ties with the village. The Leeds and Liverpool Canal provides leisure activities- boating and coarse fishing. There is an inn on the canal "The Ship Inn". The grand- father of a boy in our school worked on the canal and was also a Clog Dancer - the origin of Tap dancing.
